meanings.definition: Used as a polite or formal way of addressing a man.
meanings.sent1: Excuse me, sirs, could you please help me find the library?
meanings.sent2: The sirs at the meeting were all very respectful and attentive.
meanings.sent3: The young boy jokingly said, 'Good day, sirs, may I have some more cookies?'
meanings.sent4: The wise old man was like a beacon of knowledge among the sirs in the village.
meanings.sent5: The word 'sirs' is a sign of respect towards older gentlemen.

meanings.definition: Used to express surprise or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: Sirs! Look at that amazing sunset!
meanings.sent2: Oh sirs, I can't believe how fast time flies.
meanings.sent3: Sirs, did you see that squirrel do a backflip? It was incredible!
meanings.sent4: In the distance, sirs, the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Sirs, the beauty of nature never fails to amaze me.

meanings.definition: Used as a title before a man's name.
meanings.sent1: Mr. Smith, sirs, will be joining us for dinner tonight.
meanings.sent2: Sirs John and William arrived at the event together.
meanings.sent3: The cat, sirs Whiskers, was known for his mischievous antics.
meanings.sent4: Sirs Henry, the knight, rode valiantly into battle.
meanings.sent5: The title 'sirs' added a touch of formality to the occasion.
